deals.pitchHtml:
A car with a muddy exterior tells passengers of rugged off-roading sessions, whereas a car with a muddy interior tells passengers of carpoolings with Swamp Thing. Pick your passengers wisely with this Groupon.

Choose Between Two Options

  • Carpet shampoo and steam

Though Harv's Car Wash sometimes features a discounted price online, this Groupon still offers the best deal available.

$20 for $40 Worth of Contemporary Vietnamese Cuisine

Butternut squash tempers the spiciness of yellow curry chicken ($18.75), and chopped mango adds sweetness to ribbons of beef ($23.50). The five-spiced grilled lamb chops ($31.25) come with bok choy and shiitake mushrooms. See the complete dinner menu.

deals.title: Bon Jovi: Because We Can – The Tour at HP Pavilion at San Jose on April 25 at 7:30 p.m. (Up to 51% Off)

merchant.name: Bon Jovi: Because We Can - The Tour

deals.highlightsHtml: In support of their latest chart-topping album, Bon Jovi mixes new hits with such classics as “It’s My Life” and “Livin’ on a Prayer”
deals.pitchHtml:
Holding up lighters at concerts dates back to medieval times, when villagers gathered with torches to frighten the loudest person in town. Face the music with this GrouponLive deal.

The Deal

  • One G-Pass to Bon Jovi: Because We Can – The Tour
  • When: Thursday, April 25, at 7:30 p.m.
  • Where: HP Pavilion at San Jose
  • Door time: 6:30 p.m.
  • Ticket values include all fees.

Seating Options

  • $13 for rear-stage sections 220–224 (up to a $26.75 value)
  • $26 for sections 205–211 (up to a $50.25 value)
  • Click here to view the seating chart.

Because the ticket is a G-Pass, Groupon customers can use it to enter the venue directly; they will not need to redeem their Groupon at will call. Due to security restrictions, G-Passes must be printed out and presented in person at the event. They cannot be redeemed through Groupon's mobile app.

Bon Jovi

With more than 125 million records sold, more than 2,700 concerts performed, and a million faces seen and rocked, Bon Jovi has carved out a New Jersey-size place in the rock pantheon. The band's current trek into stadiums and arenas around the globe solidifies its status as the world's most pleasing natural phenomenon after pizza volcanoes. Bona fide Bon Jovi fans can hope to hear songs from the band's most recent chart-topping album, What About Now, along with classic smash hits such as "Livin' on a Prayer," "You Give Love a Bad Name," and "It's My Life." Remind the city that it was built upon subterranean deposits of liquid rock 'n' roll with a night of rollicking, riffing, and sentimental sing-alongs.

deals.highlightsHtml: 90-minute series of 26 basic postures pushes mental and physical limits by being performed in rooms heated to 105 degrees
deals.pitchHtml:
Star athletes thrive during the peak of heated competition, which is why most college bowl games are held in volcanoes. Stretch the limits of your limbs with this Groupon.

Choose from Three Options

  • $34 for 10 drop-in classes (a $140 value)
  • $69 for 25 drop-in classes (a $300 value)
  • $299 for a six-month unlimited membership (a $600 value)

In a heated studio, yogis lead students through the classic, intense 26 asanas and breathing exercises of Bikram yoga. Classes run every day—some starting as early as 5:30 a.m. and others as late as 8:15 p.m. Guests should wear light clothes, bring water, and avoid eating before class. Although the 10-class option is only valid for new customers, the 25-class option and six-month membership may be used by new customers or existing customers who have not visited within the past six months.

deals.highlightsHtml: Winemaker shares his expertise in the tasting of select variety of Quinta Cruz wines during special wine tasting weekend
deals.pitchHtml:
True wine connoisseurs teach themselves to distinguish varietals, identify flawed bottles, and cry pure Albarino. Become one with the grape with this Groupon.

Choose from Four Options

  • $29 for a wine tasting for two on Saturday, April 27 (a $60 value), plus a $10 credit toward wine
  • $39 a wine tasting for two on Saturday, April 27 (a $60 value), with a take-home bottle of touriga wine (a $24 value; an $84 total value)
  • $29 for a wine tasting for two on Sunday, April 28 (a $60 value), plus a $10 credit toward wine
  • $39 a wine tasting for two on Sunday, April 28 (a $60 value), with a take-home bottle of touriga wine (a $24 value; an $84 total value)

Tasters sip samples from Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard’s sister label, Quinta Cruz. These wines are created from grapes varieties that originated in Portugal and Spain and are now grown in California. During the event, winemaker and owner Jeff Emery educates his guests with information about each variety as it is poured. Participants can arrive anytime between 11 a.m. and 5 p.m. to take part in the ongoing event.

deals.title: $75 for San Francisco 4-Hour Cruise and Urban Winery Tour from SF Winery Cruise ($165 Value)
deals.highlightsHtml: A sparkling wine tasting on the San Francisco Bay complements the cruise trip’s three tastings at urban wineries
deals.pitchHtml:
Like Mike Tyson, wine is usually robust, is often boxed, and should never influence tattooing decisions. Imbibe the spirit of a champion with this Groupon.

$75 for San Francisco 4-Hour Cruise and Urban Winery Tour ($165 Value)

The four-hour trip kicks off with a tasting at Winery Collective, followed by a boat ride on San Francisco Bay, during which groups of at least 10 taste sparkling wine and snack on cheese, crackers and fruit. When the boat arrives at Treasure Island, the group enjoys two more tastings—one at The Winery SF and the other at VIE Winery—before returning to Pier 39. Cruises run on select Saturdays and Sundays, and start at 11:30 a.m. Passengers enjoy a 10% discount on cases purchased at any urban winery they visit. For more information, see the full cruise description.

The 45- to 60-minute service begins with a physical inspection before staffers gussy up smoke chutes with long poles, brushes, and scrapers. To conclude, they'll clean up fallen debris.

deals.title: One or Two Keratin Treatments at Utopik Salon (Up to 53% Off)
deals.highlightsHtml: Nutritive keratin treatments de-frizz hair for roughly two months, pairing a keratin mask with keratin shampoo by Barcelona’s Hipertin
deals.pitchHtml:
Smoothing out your hair in the morning is a hassle, typically involving haranguing it with a straightening iron or running it through the fingers of a jazz pianist. Simplify your routine with this Groupon.

Choose Between Two Options

  • $39 for one keratin treatment (an $80 value)
  • $75 for two keratin treatments (a $160 value)

After treating hair with a keratin mask and an enriching multivitamin complex, the stylist washes it with keratin shampoo and styles it with formaldehyde-free products. The treatment, which uses hair products by Barcelona-based Hipertin, smooths and shines hair for roughly two months.

Some hair-straightening products that claim to be formaldehyde-free include aldehyde compounds, which are similar to the carcinogen formaldehyde. Side effects may include nosebleeds, headaches, vomiting, and respiratory problems, among others. Learn more about the health risks here.

deals.title: One-Night Stay at Hotel Avante in Mountain View, CA, Valid for Thursday-Sunday Check-In
deals.highlightsHtml: Elegant hotel with complimentary full breakfast and a heated outdoor pool & spa; just minutes from Mountain View attractions and businesses
deals.pitchHtml:
Elegant Hotel Close to Tech Headquarters and the Bay

Some of the world’s biggest tech companies, including Google, Mozilla Foundation, and Intuit, are headquartered in Mountain View, California, a Silicon Valley city named for its lovely views of the Santa Cruz Mountains. Hotel Avante sits just outside the city’s quaint downtown, within easy driving distance of picturesque Shoreline Park and a number of Silicon Valley HQs. The nearby tech giants may have influenced the hotel—an Etch-a-Sketch and Rubik’s Cube in each room helped Hotel Avante earn a spot on Wired’s list of the nation’s geekiest hotels.

Hotel Avante’s luxurious guest rooms feature Egyptian cotton linens, 32-inch flat-screen TVs, and moveable furniture so you can achieve feng shui or build a killer fort. For a little more space, choose the upgraded Deluxe King rooms, which have rain showerheads and iPod docking stations. Each morning there’s a complimentary full breakfast. Afterwards, you can take a dip in the heated outdoor pool and hot tub.

Greater San Jose, California: Silicon Valley’s Largest City near Wine Country

Mountain View is located in between Palo Alto and San Jose, and its neighboring cities collectively host the headquarters of Silicon Valley’s most-prominent businesses, including Apple, Google, and Intel. The influx of money from the tech sector has attracted fine-dining restaurants, shops, and a thriving arts scene. Mountain View is home to the spectacular Shoreline Amphitheatre, which hosts outdoor shows year-round. In San Jose, you’ll find a renowned contemporary art collection at the San Jose Museum of Art, as well as venues for the symphony, opera, and ballet.

Microchips haven’t completely taken over the farmland around San Jose, though. The jagged Santa Cruz Mountains and rolling valleys have rich soils for growing grapes. Silicon Valley’s wine country—also known as the Santa Clara Valley—has more than 20 wineries that produce pinot noir, syrah, and zinfandel. There’s also a wide selection of golf courses that you can enjoy year-round thanks to the area’s Mediterranean-like weather.

Read the Fine Print for important info on travel dates and other restrictions.

deals.highlightsHtml: Jeanette Arnaout channels more than 20 years of equine experience to carefully guide students of all skill levels at full-day summer camps
deals.pitchHtml:
Horses and humans have worked together for centuries, transporting goods, fording rivers, and sharing the blame for the fall of Troy. Bond with the noblest of creatures with this Groupon.

$199 for a Four-Day Kids' Horseback-Riding Summer Camp ($400 Value)

Jeanette lends her riding expertise to kids aged 5–17 during four-day summer camps, which run from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday–Thursday. Camps run every week from June 10 through August 12, setting the stage for group learning punctuated by a lunch break; students should bring their own lunch. Jeanette provides all of the equipment necessary to mount and steer gentle, friendly horses suitable for riders of all skill levels. At the camp's finale on Thursday, students paint and decorate steeds to show off their artistic prowess and equestrian know-how to parents.

options.title: Summer camp for one

details.description: Limit 1 per person, may buy 1 additional as a gift. Limit 1 per visit. Registration required. 24hr cancellation notice required. Must be aged 5-17. Must sign waiver.

deals.title: Two- or Three-Night Stay at Long Barn Lodge in Long Barn, CA
deals.highlightsHtml: Historic mountain lodge with outdoor pool, volleyball court, and barbecue pit; located amid the Stanislaus National Forest in Sierra Nevadas
deals.pitchHtml:
Top Reasons to Stay at the Long Barn Lodge

  • Located amid the Stanislaus National Forest in the Sierra Nevadas, the Long Barn Lodge offers plenty of recreational activities, from swimming in the outdoor pool to playing volleyball or horseshoes.
  • The lodge dates back to 1925, when rancher Warren Beal built the structure as a boarding house for travelers heading over the Sonora Pass.
  • Two-queen guest rooms are tucked into the lodge’s main building. Freestanding studio cabins provide ample space for families for four and are equipped with a full kitchen and cable TV.
  • You can venture into town to grab dinner, or borrow one of the lodge’s barbecues to grill your own meal.
  • Yosemite National Park is less than two hours’ drive away. There, you can hike amid waterfalls in spring and early summer, horseback ride down scenic trails, or walk past the cliffs at Yosemite Valley.

Long Barn, California: Fishing, Swimming, and Biking in the Sierra Nevadas

The small, rustic town of Long Barn, California is located within the Stanislaus National Forest in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. The area is rife with outdoor activity no matter the season, but it’s particularly vibrant during the summer months. At nearby Pinecrest Lake, you can fish, hike, swim, and boat during the day, and catch an after-dark flick at the Pinecrest Amphitheater. With hundreds of miles of dirt trails and four mountain passes, Long Barn is also a popular destination for both on- and off-road motorcycle riding.

There are also two recommended day trips within a two-hour drive of Long Barn. Two hours east is Bodie, one of California’s most famous ghost towns. Once a gold rush-era boomtown with more than 65 saloons, Bodie was deserted in the early 20th century. Today, it’s a State Historic Park that’s open to the public with 100 well-preserved structures.

Less than 90 miles south of Long Barn lies the entrance to Yosemite National Park, which welcomes millions of annual visitors. Spring is one of the best times to see the park’s famed waterfalls, thanks to the snowmelt brought on by warmer weather. Yosemite Falls—a three-tiered waterfall that’s considered North America’s highest—transforms into thundering cataracts each spring. Serious hikers can trek to the top on the strenuous Upper Yosemite Falls trail, which gains 2,700 feet in elevation in just 3.5 miles.

Read the Fine Print for important info on travel dates and other restrictions.

deals.title: Four- or Seven-Night Stay with Meals and Snorkeling or Dive Trips at Blackbird Caye Resort in Turneffe Atoll, Belize
deals.highlightsHtml: Dive in Belize’s Great Blue Hole or kayak past dolphins at this Caribbean resort with freestanding cabanas
deals.pitchHtml:
Freestanding Cabanas Along Belizean Atoll

Of the three atolls off Belize's coast, Turneffe Atoll has the most biologically diverse coral reefs, thanks to the mangrove-speckled islands acting as nurseries for tropical fish, manatees, and dolphins. Located on an island within Turneffe Atoll, Blackbird Caye Resort overlooks a 2-mile-long private beach nestled among coconut trees and 1,300 acres of jungle. If you walk down the beach’s two whitewashed docks that extend into the Caribbean, you might spot bonefish, barracuda, stingrays, and nurse sharks.

With ocean temperatures hovering around 82 degrees, scuba diving and snorkeling are Turneffe Atoll's main attractions. More than 70 diving and snorkeling sites are within a 15-minute boat ride of Blackbird. Explore shallow reefs on snorkeling trips, which take you among coral, sea fans, and brightly colored fish. Use the resort’s complimentary sea kayaks to navigate mangrove-laden lagoons and spot dolphins. The resort offers three daily dives, two daily snorkeling trips and kayak expeditions, and one weekly diving trip to Belize’s famous Great Blue Hole.

After a day spent exploring the sea, retire to your private beachfront cabana covered with a thatched roof. Standard, superior, and deluxe cabanas come with air conditioning and private porches with hammocks. Each day, the resort’s palapa-style restaurant at the main dock serves three meals of fresh island cuisine. Dinner is a sit-down affair with your choice of meat, chicken, or fish, plus a housemade dessert.

Turneffe Atoll, Belize: World-Class Scuba Diving and Snorkeling

Located about 25 miles off the coast of Belize City, Blackbird Caye Resort is only a short boat ride from the Great Blue Hole, one of Belize's most iconic natural landmarks. Located near the middle of Lighthouse Reef, the Great Blue Hole is a 400-foot-deep limestone sinkhole that forms a nearly perfect circle in a brilliant shade of navy blue. As divers descend into the hole, they see limestone stalactites and stalagmites hanging off the walls.

Half Moon Caye Natural Monument in the southeast corner of Lighthouse Reef is home to some of Belize's most exotic land animals as well as a diverse assortment of underwater creatures. Rare red-footed boobies nest on the cay for about 10 months out of the year, then spend the other 2 months playing shuffleboard in Naples.

Read the Fine Print for important info on travel dates and other restrictions.

deals.title: 8x8 or 8x11 Custom Photo Book from Shutterfly (Up to 67% Off)
deals.highlightsHtml: Hardcover book filled with personal photos customized with your choice of styles, page layouts, and captions
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

  • $10 for a customizable 8x8 photo book from Shutterfly ($29.99 list price). Shipping is an additional $7.99 for this option.

  • $15 for a customizable 8x11 photo book from Shutterfly ($34.99 list price). Shipping is an additional $8.99 for this option.

  • After purchasing this deal, you will need to visit the manufacturer's website to complete redemption. See your Groupon voucher for more detailed instructions.

Customizable Photo Book from Shutterfly

Shutterfly's photo books contain 20 or more pages (up to 110 pages available for an extra charge) of photographs printed on high-quality photo paper and professionally bound in a sturdy hardcover fold. Create a special Mother's Day gift or keepsake of family memories and choose between Shutterfly's Simple Path with preset backgrounds and layouts or the Custom Path feature, which allows you to customize each book with unique styles, page layouts, and captions. View the finished product online before having it published. Once it ships and is delivered, use it to spruce up a coffee table, personal library or stack of books.

Features
  • Each book contains 20 pages (up to 110 pages for an extra charge)
  • Printed on high-quality photo paper
  • Professionally bound with a hardcover
  • Constructed online using premade or customizable templates
  • Designs for all occasions and styles
  • Customized by style, page layout, image size, and text
  • Share unlimited online storage albums with friends, family, and those who choose not to be so easily pigeonholed, like pets
  • 100% satisfaction guarantee from Shutterfly

How to get your goods: after purchasing this deal, pull up your Groupon with our mobile app or by going to My Groupons (or to My Gifts if you are giving this as a gift*) and clicking the view voucher link. Then, follow the instructions on your voucher.

deals.title: Akribos XXIV Ceramic Watches for Men and Women (Up to 93% Off). 12 Styles Available. Free Shipping and Returns.

merchant.name: Akribos XXIV White Ceramic Watches for Men and Women

deals.highlightsHtml: Elegant watches with white ceramic cases; some designs flaunt crystal accents or mother-of-pearl dials
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

  • Akribos XXIV ceramic watches for men and women starting at $49.99
  • Click here to view an image and detailed specification for each option.

Akribos XXIV

It seems only natural for a watchmaker to be concerned with history. The founders of Akribos XXIV were fascinated by the ancient history of timekeeping, which has roots in Greece and Rome. To commemorate the ancient art, they named their company for the two powers. In Greek, Akribos means “exact and precise;” XXIV are the Roman numerals for 24, as well as Prince’s latest signature. Taken together, the name both pays homage to the past and makes a promise for the future. Each timepiece the company crafts is meticulously designed to track all 24 hours in a day. Furthermore, every watch doubles as an eye-catching accessory. Details such as sunray dials, crystal-accented bezels, and braided bracelets represent the company’s distinctive style: bold, fashion-forward, and functional.

Features
  • Watches for men and women
  • Analog display
  • White ceramic cases
  • Some styles feature mother-of-pearl dials or crystal accents
  • Japanese or Swiss quartz movement
  • Water resistant like a coconut in a swim cap

How to get your goods: by purchasing this Groupon and providing your name and shipping address, your order is complete!

For questions pertaining to this deal, please visit the deal Q&A on this page. For post-purchase inquiries, please contact Groupon customer service.

  • 35mm camera

  • Flashlight

Click here to view an image of each option.

Three-Piece Adventure Kits

These kits allow kids to bring their favorite characters along with them on creative adventures. The binoculars allow kids to scope out birds hiding in trees or parents crouched behind bushes so they can sneak closer for a shot with the 35mm camera. The flashlight projects light up to 10 feet away and aids after-dark rendezvous with action figures or storybooks.

Features
  • Character-themed kits
  • Focus-free camera uses 35mm film
  • 4”x28” binoculars for bird-watching or celebrity-sighting
  • Flashlight shines for up to 10 feet
  • Flashlight requires two AA batteries (not included)

How to get your goods: by purchasing this Groupon and providing your name and shipping address, your order is complete!
